comment._content: What a truly wonderfull series of pictures TWAM, much enjoyed, much appreciated.

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content: Fantastic, I'm glad everyone is enjoying them.

comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: I thought Austro-Hungary was land-locked.  Where was its navy based?

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content: Before the First World War the empire had ports on the Adriatic, in areas that subsequently became part of Italy and Yugoslavia. Trieste was probably the most important, although the Austrian emperor also controlled Venice for a while.

comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/twm_news] Thanks. Kind of you to take trouble to reply.  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/alimarante] I love this set too.  I'm a Londoner who had three wonderful years working in Newcastle 1969-1972 and sad I had to leave. And some of my immigrant great-grandfolks first settled in now-demolished streets near St.James's Park.
